articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: Tens of thousands of pro-Palestinian protesters were expected to gather at the Democratic National Convention on its opening day on Monday to assail the Biden administration's position on Israel as it wages its war in Gaza.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian protests loom ahead of first day of Democratic convention

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A bomb blast in Tel Aviv late on Sunday has been confirmed as a terrorist attack, Israeli police and the Shin Bet domestic intelligence agency said on Monday.
articles.title: Deadly bomb blast in Tel Aviv was a terrorist attack, Israeli police say

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinian Islamist group Hamas has cast doubt on the chances of reaching a deal since talks in Qatar last week paused without a breakthrough.
articles.title: Blinken warns Israel, Hamas of last chance to end Gaza war

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Moscow said on Monday Ukraine had struck a third bridge in an assault on Russia's Kursk region which Kyiv says is aimed at carving out a buffer zone and wearing down Russia's war machine.
articles.title: Russia says Ukraine has hit third bridge in assault on Kursk region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One person died and six people were missing after a luxury yacht was struck by a whirlwind and sank off the coast of the Sicilian capital Palermo, Italian media reported.
articles.title: One reported dead, six missing after yacht sinks off Sicily

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's Coast Guard said a Philippine vessel that had ignored its repeated warnings "deliberately collided" with a Chinese vessel in an "unprofessional and dangerous" manner in the disputed South China Sea, according to statements on Monday.
articles.title: China says Philippine vessel 'deliberately collided' with Chinese vessel in the South China Sea

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhury
articles.description: Thousands of Indian junior doctors on Monday refused to end protests over the rape and murder of a fellow medic, disrupting hospital services nearly a week since they launched a nation-wide action demanding safer workplace and swift criminal action.
articles.title: Indian medics refuse to end protests over doctor's rape and murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Firefighters backed by 40 vehicles and a helicopter struggled to contain a wildfire on Monday on the southern coast of Portugal's island of Madeira that has burnt through more than 3,000 hectares (7,410 acres) of forest over the past five days.
articles.title: Madeira battles wildfire for fifth day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kenya's government will have to bring back some tax measures that it scrapped after deadly protests in June, the finance minister said, raising the risk of further unrest.
articles.title: Kenya to bring back some scrapped tax plans, risking more unrest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A blast and fire on a fuel pipeline at the Sterlitamak petrochemical plant in Russia's Bashkiria region east of Moscow injured three people, local authorities said on Monday.
articles.title: Blast at Russian petrochemical plant injures three
